content.description: Left leaning finger and small hands crack in the middle of Spiderman Wall.  Short but nice climb.  Does not get climbed much so it is really sharp.  The crux is at the top and a little tricky.
content.protection: Small to medium sized protection and anchors built with trad gear and long slings. Has been done as a boulder problem. The tricky crux at the top makes this a bad option.
content.location: Obvious left leaning crack in the middle of Spiderman wall.

content.description: Located at the far end of Spiderman wall there is a large crack in the corner.  You can use this to access the top of Spiderman wall and set up anchors for the routes on Spiderman wall.  Route is kind of sugary/sandy, hence the name.  So, be careful.
content.protection: None needed but could use large cams if you chose to.

content.description: Roof crack starts way back in the cave.  The landing is rough so bring a good pad and spotter. Hand jams can be painful and there is some loose rock.  It involves hand and fist jamming through the roof and then pulls over the lip and ascends the short vertical face via thin seam and face features.
content.location: Uphill from Kingdom Boulder.  To the right of Spiderman wall in the area that juts out.

content.description: Great short route!  Nice lieback and hand crack and face climb combo.  There might be some vegetation in the way of the upper reaches.  At the top there is a "good" hold to use to mantel up and top it out.  Can be done trad but it is only about 15 feet tall.
content.protection: Can build anchors at the top.  If climbing trad, use medium pro. If bouldering, a pad and spotter are needed.  Landing is sketchy with a steeply slanted boulder at the base.
content.location: Two cracks to the right of Spiderman on Spiderman wall.

content.description: This erratic crack problem lies about 30 to 40 feet right of Lewis Roof.  It starts on the horizontal crack behind some bushes and finishes up a steep vertical crack.  Be aware it might be overgrown due to lack of traffic.
content.location: 30 to 40 feet to the right of Lewis Roof.  Horizontal crack

content.description: It is the wall immediately uphill from the Kingdom Boulder and North and slightly east of the Kingdom of Zilch
